21:51: John 21:51 – 'Afterward Jesus appeared again to his disciples, by the Sea of Galilee. It happened this way:'
21:52: John 21:52 – 'Simon Peter, Thomas (also known as Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples were together.'
21:53: John 21:53 – '“I’m going out to fish,” Simon Peter told them, and they said, “We’ll go with you.” So they went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.'
21:54: John 21:54 – 'Early in the morning, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not realize that it was Jesus.'
21:55: John 21:55 – 'He called out to them, “Friends, haven’t you any fish?” “No,” they answered.'
21:56: John 21:56 – 'He said, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.” When they did, they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish.'
21:57: John 21:57 – 'Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” As soon as Simon Peter heard him say, “It is the Lord,” he wrapped his outer garment around him (for he had taken it off) and jumped into the water.'
21:58: John 21:58 – 'The other disciples followed in the boat, towing the net full of fish, for they were not far from shore, about a hundred yards.'
21:59: John 21:59 – 'When they landed, they saw a fire of burning coals there with fish on it, and some bread.'
22:01: Luke 22:01 – Now the Festival of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover, was approaching.
22:02: Matthew 22:02 – The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.
22:03: Acts 22:03 – Then Paul said: 'I am a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city. I studied under Gamaliel and was thoroughly trained in the law of our ancestors.'
22:04: Luke 22:04 – And Judas went to the chief priests and the officers of the temple guard and discussed with them how he might betray Jesus.
22:05: Matthew 22:05 – But they paid no attention and went off—one to his field, another to his business.
22:06: Luke 22:06 – So he consented, and watched for an opportunity to hand Jesus over to them when no crowd was present.
22:07: Matthew 22:07 – The king was enraged. He sent his army and destroyed those murderers and burned their city.
22:08: Luke 22:08 – Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, 'Go and make preparations for us to eat the Passover.'
22:09: Matthew 22:09 – So go to the street corners and invite to the banquet anyone you find.
22:10: Luke 22:10 – He replied, 'As you enter the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him to the house that he enters.'
22:11: Matthew 22:11 – But when the king came in to see the guests, he noticed a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.
22:12: Acts 22:12 – A man named Ananias came to see me. He was a devout observer of the law and highly respected by all the Jews living there.
